alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 28 at 5:54PM EDT until October 29 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding mainly along the St Johns River and tributaries. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Duval County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 4 AM EDT Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, until 5 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
